meanings.definition: The quality or state of being definite or clearly defined.
meanings.sent1: The definitude of the instructions made it easy to follow.
meanings.sent2: The definitude of the map helped us find our way without any confusion.
meanings.sent3: She joked about the definitude of her schedule, knowing she was always running late.
meanings.sent4: The definitude of his decision was like a beacon in the fog of uncertainty.
meanings.sent5: The definitude of the answer left no room for doubt.

meanings.definition: The degree of precision or exactness in defining something.
meanings.sent1: The definitude of the measurements ensured accurate results.
meanings.sent2: His definitude in describing the crime scene impressed the detectives.
meanings.sent3: The definitude of her memory was so sharp, she could recall every detail.
meanings.sent4: The definitude of his aim with the dart was unmatched in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The definitude of the artist's brushstrokes captured every detail perfectly.
